tasks.task: Replace a rusty nut on a piece of farm equipment.
subtasks: Hold the impact wrench with both hands.
Align the half-inch drive socket with the nut.
Apply pressure to the impact wrench to engage the torque.
Turn the wrench counterclockwise to loosen the rusty bolt.
Remove the old breaker bar and replace it with the impact wrench.
Check that the reversible air impact wrench is functioning properly.

tasks.task: Inspect the torque settings of the impact wrench.
subtasks: Adjust the torque settings to 1,000 foot pounds.
Verify that the torque is correct by testing it on a non-critical fastener.

tasks.task: Secure the new component to the piece of farm equipment.
subtasks: Position the new component correctly on the equipment.
Align the holes of the new component with the existing bolts.
Apply适当润滑 to the threads of the new bolts.
Insert the new bolts into the aligned holes.
Hand-tighten the new bolts to hold the component in place.
Use the impact wrench to torque the new bolts to 1,000 foot pounds.
Check the torque with a torque wrench if necessary.

tasks.task: Remove any debris from the removal of the old bolt.
subtasks: Clear away any rust, metal chips, or dirt from the bolt hole.
Inspect the bolt hole for any damage or wear.

tasks.task: Inspect the condition of the new component.
subtasks: Check that the component is seated properly on the equipment.
Look for any damage or deformities on the component.
Confirm that all hardware is present and accounted for.
Apply a rust-preventative lubricant to the threads of the new bolts.
Wipe off any excess lubricant to prevent attracting dirt.

tasks.task: Tighten the retaining rings if applicable.
subtasks: Position the retaining rings over the new bolts.
Use a punch and hammer to set the retaining rings properly.

tasks.task: Apply a fresh coat of paint or rustproofing to the bolt area.
subtasks: Mix the rustproofing solution if needed.
Apply the solution evenly over the bolt area.
Allow the paint or rustproofing to dry completely.
Remove the old nut, bolt, and any other debris.
Dispose of the old components properly.
Wipe down the impact wrench and any tools used.
Store the tools and replacement parts in their designated places.
